results.title: Sky cries Mary until the grinders cease
results.creator_credit: Sky Cries Mary, Terry Amidei and A J Pruzan
results.brief_description: A pulsating montage of image and music from experimental music artists, Sky Cries Mary. Six pieces are performed - 1. Propergenda 2. Barh House 3. Und die flamen 4. Shakespeare factory 5. When fear stops 6. 9 Nite chant. All music is written and performed by Roderick Auer Stringfellow.

results.title: Sky bridges
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
The story of three men who fly around outback Australia to do their particular type of work. Dr Ian Robertson works for the Royal Flying Doctor Service, Tony Matthews is an Anglican Archdeacon with the Carpentaria Aerial Mission and Mervyn Moriarty is an artist teaching art with the Australian Flying Art School. Commentator: Tim Eliott

results.title: Sky at Westminster Abbey
results.brief_description: Recorded at a concert given to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the founding in Britain of Amnesty International. Performed in front of a live audience at the magnificent and atmospheric Westminster Abbey, this internationally acclaimed British rock band presents a fusion of rock and classical music ranging from the interpretive strains of electronic keyboards and synthesisers through to the poetic mellow sounds of acoustic guitars. Consisting of five extremely talented musicians (John Williams and Kevin Peek on classical and electric guitar, Herbie Flowers on bass guitar, Steve Gray on keyboards and synthesisers and Tristan Fry on percussion) and featuring breath-taking images of the wonderful gothic architectural environment that is Westminster Abbey, this video is most enjoyable, both visually and musically.

results.title: Sky above; Sweet fresh water; The Margins of the land
results.brief_description: A compilation program narrated by David Attenborough which examines flight in birds, animals and insects, freshwater ecology including that of the Amazon, and coastal ecology.

results.title: Sky
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and John Feeney
results.brief_description: From the height of the Rockies on the rim of the western plains, the film catches and condenses the astounding spectacle of a day in the life of the sky. Photographed with many kinds of lenses and at different camera speeds, the result is a cinematographic experience of rare beauty - every changing mood of the sky is vividly registered. Film without words.

results.title: Skull, spine, and pelvis
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy and Pathescope Company of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “First Aid for Fractures”.
Explains the seriousness of fractures of the skull, spine and pelvis. Through a series of simulated cases aboard ship and in the field, depicts specific procedures for recognising and treating each of these types of fractures. Suitable for medical and nursing professions and training of students.

results.title: Skud
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, Hugh Burton and Donna Swan
results.brief_description: Tasha comes from a dysfunctional family; alcoholic mother, abusive father and absent sister. She finds release in boxing and becomes friends with Matt whom she meets at a youth referral centre. Matt has his own problems, spending his time graffiting his tag, ‘Skud’, around railway stations and aspiring to train surfing. Matt drags Tasha into his world, compounding her problems and reaching a tragic conclusion. Starring Heather Bradley, Samuel Johnson, Lynda Gibson and Jules Hutchison.

results.title: Skittles
results.creator_credit: Daniel McCrimmon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Daniel McCrimmon moved to Shepparton eight and a half years ago. He tells us of his time there, his friends, favorite places and his ambitions for the future.
